title: dark was the night
content:
hello, would anyone be kind enough to tell me what font this is? thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090414010404im_/http:/typophile.com/files/61PxzuG72ZL_3582._SS500_.jpg)
author: qtzlctl

comments.content: It seems like lettering to me. The repeated letters (A, T) are not exactly the same.

I agree with Cristobal, but you might find that [Superstar](http://web.archive.org/web/20090414010404/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/superstar/) has a similarity to this.

- Mike Yanega
hmm, that is quite close. Thank you!

I’ve seen this poster locally. What is it for? Some CD compilation I think. I’d love to know who did it and whether this bit is actually an old engraving or they managed to do a really good engraving effect.

Looks like a customized [Archive Steeler](http://web.archive.org/web/20090414010404/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/archivetype/archive-steeler/) to me.

This is the cover of a CD compilation. It looks to be designed by Funny Garbage and Ryan Feerer. It also says that the background art and illustrations were taken from Gustave Dore’s illustrated version of Paradise Lost. Dore’s illustrations are detailed engravings, so my guess is that all of the engraving textures are taken from that.

Very lovely cover, in my opinion.

_I’ve seen this poster locally. What is it for? Some CD compilation I think._

This is indeed a compilation. Brought to you by the [Red Hot Organization](http://web.archive.org/web/20090414010404/http:/www.redhot.org/info/index.html), which has released other compilations, like [_Red Hot + Blue_](http://web.archive.org/web/20090414010404/http:/www.redhot.org/projects/blue.html) and [_No Alternative_](http://web.archive.org/web/20090414010404/http:/www.redhot.org/projects/noalt.html).

Read more about the compilation on [its own website](http://web.archive.org/web/20090414010404/http:/www.darkwasthenight.com/).
